Description: Veined calcite bowl: with convex sides rising vertically to plain rim. The base, although rather flattened, is still convex with ill-defined edges, and it is pierced by a hole caused by excessive hollowing in manufacture.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Qaa, tomb Q.21 subsidiary burial
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I 28, pl.XXXVIII, 8; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. LI F, 311.
